website_summaries.verdict: While this watch winder is a bit plain looking, it works quietly and holds larger watches than most competitors.
pros: Though this winder doesn't have pillows to hold watches like some more expensive models, the spring holders accommodate for larger watches
Customers love this machine's silent operation and the included AC adapter
cons: Some customers found that this winder did not wind their watches properly

customer_reviews.title: Warranty claim ignored.
customer_reviews.text: Has a 1-year warranty, mine quit right after 11-months. The only way I can find to contact manufacturer, is the email "diplomatwinders@gmail.com" listed in the owner's manual. However, I got NO response. Amazon does NOT offer any way to return it through them, even though they listed the seller as "Sold by: Amazon.com Services, Inc.". But, when I pull up the online invoice, no buttons nor links to follow on how to return or file a warranty claim. This is getting upsetting, as now I only have 3-days left on warranty! When it worked, it worked fine, kept my automatics wound, and was quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Tn Vol

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, completely silent and effective
customer_reviews.text: Completely silent and effective. This thing makes absolutely no sound and has plenty of versatility with 4 different settings from 300 turns per day (TPN) up to 2000 TPN's. Clockwise, Counter or bidirectional depending on what you watch prefers. Check on the database on Orbita.com for most watch models. It is plastic but well made and a fraction of the price compared to fancy winders such as can also be found in Orbita.com. If you love mechanical watches but don't want to spend more on the winder than on the watch, this is a must.
customer_reviews.author: mendez

customer_reviews.title: Better for larger watches
customer_reviews.text: I needed a winder that would fit larger watches. I have an average size man's wrist but find that the winders with "pillows" for the watch bands are too small. The watch just flops around in the winder unless you can stuff some foam between the watch band and the pillow. This winder has a spring loaded device to exert enough pressure to hold the band. One note, when I first set it up, the upper winder did not work. After switching from auto rotation to clockwise/counterclockwise and back it started working.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: This a great double winder
customer_reviews.text: This a great double winder.It is built much better than I had expected. It is very reliable and super quiet. I like how the watches sit in the winder. You don't have to worry about them moving about so much. The watch holder is actually spring loaded so it fits your watch much better thean a pillow which is used in a lot of winders. And it looks good, not cheap. You will love this winder, and really love the price..
customer_reviews.author: M. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: OK, the winder is made out of plastic and feels like it, but then again it had a really low price. The noise was just a bit loud for me, as I keep it on the nightstand next to my bed--had I not located it so near my head it wouldn't have been an issue at all. Instead of relocating the winder to a less convenient spot, I unscrewed the front panel and glued some thick felt padding to inside of the walls surrounding the mechanism; that greatly reduced the noise transmission through the enclosure.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stegeman

customer_reviews.title: its nice seeing them rotate
customer_reviews.text: arrived promptly. the device is very handy. i had one automatic watch that i recently bought but wanted to keep running as i alternated with my original quartz watch. the machine is loud, but still unnoticeable. shortly after buying this, i bought another mechanical watch but now i cant keep all 3 watches in this watchwinder. i wish i would have thought ahead. anyway, i wanted to keep my quartz in this alongside with my automatics for display purposes. its nice seeing them rotate. very elegant design. think ahead people!
customer_reviews.author: Burrito

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This is far superior to  which I'd bought previously. The spring-loaded watch clamps in this product are so much easier to use than the pillows in the other. And, unlike the other product, this is accurately displayed on Amazon's website. You can't go wrong with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product and the value of money
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd purchased of a Diplomat watch winder for my automatic watches. The first diplomat watch winder I bought was last 6 years ago and it’s still working well. The only difference with the newer diplomat brand that I just bought is less noise level. The other brand that I bought before I order this diplomat brand just lasted only less than a year and I was so disappointed. Overall I like this brand and the value of the money.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.M

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: The Diplomat watch winder is extremely good value for the money. It is plastic, and definitely not a high end product, but it works well and consistently. I have purchased two of these units for my watches and I am very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Kleven

customer_reviews.title: It is ugly but it works great
customer_reviews.text: I have had several watch winders which had beautiful wood cases and a hefty price tag. After about two years, one of the winders would break and then I had a beautiful, expensive piece of junk. I have not heard any grinding or unusual noise as mentioned in other posts. It is simple to program (unlike the more expensive versions) and keeps my watches running. The best part for me is if it stops working, I won't have any problem chunking it out (versus trying to fix it because of the expense).
customer_reviews.author: Scuba 6

customer_reviews.title: It winds two of my watches. It's quiet but ...
customer_reviews.text: It winds two of my watches. It's quiet but not silent. There's a few settings and its bi-directional. There's enough room for my 44mm Panerai. Two problems: 1) you wrap your watch around a spring-loaded plastic piece which then clicks in to the box. It works but it's doomed to eventual failure. 2) the two mounts cannot be set differently. If you're IWC winds clockwise and your Tudor winds counterclockwise, you need to pick one or the other...well I guess you could pick bi-directional and then turn it to the highest oscillation frequency...hold on, I've got to go make an adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel U.

customer_reviews.title: The next best thing to wearing my watch
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both have oyster perpetual movement watches that stop when we haven't worn them for a while. At times, it was hard to get them started if we hadn't worn them, and at times the watch would run slower for a while if it was allowed to stop. So nice to have this beautiful display that keeps the watches running when we're not wearing them. It also has different settings and sizes for different watchbands. Really good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: jdacB

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work Consistently
customer_reviews.text: This watch winder is cheap and does not work properly. The top watch winder seems to work sometimes, but the bottom one does not appear to work at all. I have the winding mechanism set on "Auto," but both upper and lower winders seem to not even work sporadically. I am going to do some online research to see if any other customers have had trouble such as this. My return window has passed, so I'm now stuck. I will be forced to purchase another watch-winder now, and I feel that I have been taken advantage of by this purchase. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: dpouzts

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 6 months, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: It's ninja quiet and keeps my Seiko 5 and Fossil watch in time, plus it wasn't that expensive so that's a plus. Unfortunately it only lasted about 6 months then completely stopped working so I can't recommend it. I was really hoping it would last much longer than it did but it's just not the case.. hopefully I can find one that is much better quality and will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: ODB

customer_reviews.title: Product was received as promised. I have very large ...
customer_reviews.text: Product was received as promised. I have very large wrists and I had to Nani fracture a way to get the watch to stay on the holder. So it is not complimentary to large watches. There is an extra pies included to accommodate large watches. The holder can handle the width and the thickness of the and thank goodness there was still enough room in the winder once I adding padding to fill the the gaps and allow the watch to stay on the holder. Overall it is working well. Note. Increase the size of the expander by approximately one inch.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Worth considering for smaller "automatic" watches
customer_reviews.text: I am still trying to adjust the cycle for this to keep my watches would. I have 3 of the smaller 1-watch units but have 5 watches needing constant motion. The unit has so far, a month, been quiet and reliable. My watches are all smaller ones, not heavy Rolex or such. So I don;t know what would happen if you loaded it up with a Breitling and a Rolex.--but then if you had these, why would you be spending $50 to buy a winder?<G>
customer_reviews.author: Mac Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected but so far working ok
customer_reviews.text: The product seems to be working as expected but the box it came in had been opened and resealed. One of the little attachments to the base of the unit was broken off. There was not enough reason to go through the trouble of sending back. How I did expect to get a new and perfect product.
customer_reviews.author: Leo M

customer_reviews.title: The Diplomat 31-497 Watch Winder is a marvelous product.
customer_reviews.text: The Diplomat 31-497 Watch Winder is a marvelous product. It is so quiet, I can't hear it running even on my bed side night stand. I bought this on the recommendation of a co-worker and I'm very glad I did. If the need arises for me to purchase another automatic watch winder, I'll buy another of the Diplomat 31-497 Watch Winder.
customer_reviews.author: Ken A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but not for everybody
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a decent product out of the box. I like the fact that you can operate the two slots using separate switches. The 120-240v range is a nice feature if you want to take this with you in your travels in case you use more than watches or as a gift to someone in another country with a different power rating. However, I am returning it because the watch holders don't fit my watches with shorter bands. If you have bigger sized bands or bracelet this product may suit you.
customer_reviews.author: Mar G.

customer_reviews.title: Whisper quiet
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it a few days but a great cheap watch winder alternative. I can't even hear it. I've already ordered another one. Hopefully it's the same whisper quiet winder. It is a cheap plastic but for the cost I can't complain as it looks decent. It's better than the MDF alternatives I've had in boxes and winders. I thought about a bigger winder but the way I look at it if needed it's easier to replace a 2 watch winder than more. The ones I really wanted were too pricey. Hopefully these last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Martin

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.text: 2/28/2018- Had this running since I got it (almost a month now) and it's working good. Keeping my watches running which is nice. Different settings so might check with the manufacturer for what they recommend but for the price, it's a good winder. Might order another one. I hear rumors that they give out after a few months so I'll update this if I start to have issues.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Functions well; concerns about scratching during rotation !
customer_reviews.text: There is no question that the winder functions well; I do have some serious concerns that the rotations will scratch my two most expensive automatic watches because of the plastic watch inserts rubbing against the plastic slots during rotation ! Given my limited navigation skills,it would be appreciated if you would forward this message to the product link of the manufacturer !
customer_reviews.author: bbell12

customer_reviews.title: Works for anything from Seiko to Rolex
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Does a phenomenal job. Quiet and keeps my watches wound. I rotate my Deep Blue (Sellita SW200 movement) my BB GMT (Tudor in house) and my Submariner (Rolex in house) in this winder. I need to add a second one at this point. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Maserati Matt

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Item worked for less than one month! Paid $50 dollars for it and then when sent back for a refund I had to lose $10 dollars for a so called restock fee!! What a joke!
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Works well, caution with Seiko Kinetic watch.
customer_reviews.text: The watch winder works well and is virtually silent. It keeps my Rolex going no problems. One word of caution when using it with my Seiko Kinetic watch. It will keep it going but not fully wound even when it's on the highest setting. It is probably the watch since I had same issue with a different brandedwinder.
customer_reviews.author: sailjr

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat winder. Its inexpensive and works as described. One star deducted because there is so much plastic and it feels cheap. But, its better than I expected. It works A-OK for now. And, its quiet. If it lasts only a couple of years... well worth it. I have more expensive winders that now seem less impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Elberg

customer_reviews.title: Broken before 2 year mark
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work after about a year and a half. Outside of warranty so not much I can do. Hoped this would last longer than cheaper ones I've bought in the past.
customer_reviews.author: OMG ICECREAM

customer_reviews.title: Good winder, but disposable after a few years
customer_reviews.text: Good inexpensive winder. They die every 2-3 years or so, but I’m on my second and would recommend it. I typically wear one watch and leave the other bank empty so probably put some unbalanced stress on it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: really good.
customer_reviews.text: Not really noisy.... keep it close to my bed and the noise is really low. Like a small fan on the other side of the room. Had no problem using to wind mid to large size watches, with 42mm or more cases... (New Seiko Monster, Tissot PRS 516, Steinhart Ocean One and SevenFriday). Also the adaptors to larger watches will do the trick if you need. Good quality materials on the case too.
customer_reviews.author: Vini

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet unit............
customer_reviews.text: This unit is so quiet that you cannot hear it running. It keeps a Rolex Submariner an a Rolex Date/Just both wound every night. A really good unit at a really good price.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet, and easy to use. It's very inexpensive, and looks it, but it works well. I was briefly disappointed that I had to tuck it out of sight, rather than use it to display a couple of watches, but then I remembered how little I paid, and decided maybe showing off watches was a little tacky anyway. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ted M

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I had a high end single watch winder and needed to upgrade when I got a second self-winder. This is a low cost option which is not as fancy as my initial single unit, but does the trick. Easy to start out of the box and it shipped when scheduled and performed as advertised. Your Rolex may be for show, but how many people are going to see the winder?
customer_reviews.author: Gary C. Dake

customer_reviews.title: I have researched how these watches like to be wound and this does what they like
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this winder on 10-22-2013. The main reason was to keep my Omega Speedmaster and a Breitling Chrono wound. However, this has proven to be an issue. Not sure if it's the winder or my timepieces the winder keeps it accurate only for a day or two. Then it seem as if it stops winding and the watches show an incorrect time. I have researched how these watches like to be wound and this does what they like. So ever time I wear one i have to correct the time/date on them.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Contains magnets
customer_reviews.text: This product contains magnets to hold the door that will potentially damage your expensive automatic watches.
customer_reviews.author: Stillard

customer_reviews.title: Nice Watch Winder
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit for my husband's Seiko Kinetic watch that was stopping due to non-use. Being retired, he doesn't wear the watch except once a week or so, not enough to keep it wound. I'm glad that I purchased this unit that holds two watches, as now I have a new Seiko Kinetic watch and I can put my watch in as well. The only drawback to this unit that I see is that you can't make it work more often. I'm not very familiar with it, but it seems to be off more than it's on. But it seems to be keeping his watch wound.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rodriquez

customer_reviews.title: Good value, almost silent.
customer_reviews.text: Good automatic watch winder. Absolutely silent in clockwise direction, makes noise in counter clockwise direction. Keep two automatics running when wearing others.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in under 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I've never dropped it or has the product gone through any torture test of any kind. Today I just discovered that mine no longer works. That's unacceptable in terms of product quality. I won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Working great so far
customer_reviews.text: I've had this winder now for 2 months and have had no problems. It is completely silent, very easy to use, and for now working as it should. I couldn't afford the more expensive winders, but according to the reviews I read they have their problems too. If I experience any problems, I will update this review. But for now, so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: compman

customer_reviews.title: Very good product and a great value
customer_reviews.text: Works just as described and it's keeping my Rolex's wound like it says it would. 5 stars would be easily attained if there were a light or some indicator that would show it's in operation. My single-winder has a light, but this one does not.
customer_reviews.author: LREII

customer_reviews.title: great design, not a sound when on, does the job, low price.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised when I first looked for watch winders, the price can go very high.. The Diplomat 31-479, is a beautiful machine that does the job with out a sound. The only way I know it's on: watch is turning. A very good design both in looks and function. plus the low price is great. I use it with the factory default setting: 1hr on,, 3hrs off; direction: cw then ccw. My winder has been in use for six days, so far it is perfect. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Richardao

customer_reviews.title: Good and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for years. Programable and quiet. Much more affordable than any comparable winder.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Sereix

customer_reviews.title: Started making sounds after about 3 months..
customer_reviews.text: After about three months the winder started making odd sounds and would not hold my watch properly. Thud, thud..
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and keeps my watches going
customer_reviews.text: This thing really is very quiet, I have it in my bedroom about 12 feet away from me and I can't hear it at all. The removable inserts are hard plastic with a foam covering where the watch is. The plastic inserts are spring loaded in order to ensure that your watch doesn't slip around and make noises every time it rotates. I've currently got it set on the 30 minute on, 3 hours off cycle and it is maintaining both watches. It's nice looking except the sticker looks somewhat silly on it.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I have watch winders costing 3 to 4x more and it's a very good quality watch winder for the price. will keep you posted long term but yeah its solid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works ok, not good on first setting
customer_reviews.text: It’s not the prettiest but it does the job. On the lowest setting my watch would lose time and I thought it was broken but then I tried the second setting and the watches are keeping its time. It’s not bad but nothing great.
customer_reviews.author: Terence Meo

customer_reviews.title: Great winder!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parents and they just love it!! They are so happy with this and glad they didn't purchase a more expensive one. It fits their watches and it winds them perfectly. It looks really nice and it well made. It's a win!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy cav

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: I have had this winder for about a week or so - it is really cool. Keeps my two battery-less watches running so I don't have to re-set every time I want to wear one of them. I didn't know that these things were made - but I wondered and googled watch winder and viola, there it was. I really think this is cool - it works, it's silent, and it has different settings - very cool indeed. Also, the Diplomat looks great. I give it five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Dean F. Blair

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This winder works better than several winders I have purchased which were more expensive. Highly recommend, will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Lakin

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this for my 2 automatic watches. It ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 2 automatic watches. It took a little time to calculate which speed setting is needed, but after it got dialed in, zero problems. I keep it in my closet, so I never hear any noise. A couple of times I have heard a slight grind sound, but come on... for $50 what did you expect?
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rayburn

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Does what is is supposed to do and is very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C

customer_reviews.title: Cheap finish, noisy.
customer_reviews.text: Annoying low humming - can't have it in the bedroom. Very cheap finish: plastic, plastic, plastic... Doesn't work with Seiko Kinetic series. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Yuri S.

customer_reviews.title: The third time is a charm
customer_reviews.text: This is my third winder. This one is the quietest and looks good on my dresser. Easy to setup and manipulate
customer_reviews.author: Tampaman

customer_reviews.title: winder
customer_reviews.text: it's bulky, liked the Excelvan better, it's compact and looks much more stylish but amazon wasn't offering it anymore
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price!
customer_reviews.text: This watch winder is great!! It's absolutely silent and has a really nice assortment of settings to handle any watch. I bought this for my wife and I would have to say that it's vastly superior to the $200 single watch winder that I have for myself. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Cohen

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Get what you pay for. Does it work??? yes...... look good??? Yes.... would probably buy again of I had to.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: No no no do not buy, as others have written. One of the winders broke just after the one year warranty mark. Coincidence I think not.
customer_reviews.author: Crow Janes

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 10 months.
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for 10 months and liked it. Then one of the two winders just stopped working entirely (the lower one). Makes a louder noise now when running as well. Curious if the manufacturer will honor the 1 year warranty. Will see...
customer_reviews.author: J. brown

customer_reviews.title: It's quiet.....important if it's near the bedroom
customer_reviews.text: I use it to keep my watches wound and current. I like the compact design and the quiet operation.
customer_reviews.author: E. Schreiner

customer_reviews.title: Working as expected
customer_reviews.text: Good working solution, only glitch is that a very small ladies wrist band is difficult to fit. Good thing the newer version, like this one has 2 sizes but still a bit to big for easy fitting and comfort. Squeezed hard and locked wrist band at a certain position worked but it's not ideal.
customer_reviews.author: OSam55

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and effective way to keep my Rolex OP Datejust and Oris Tubbataha dive watch
customer_reviews.text: Not the quietest but it works well to keep my two automatic watches charged. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Uh huh

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Noise
customer_reviews.text: It makes the most annoying clicking sound when it's winding. I can't sleep with it. I barely stand listening to it, even when I'm not trying to fall asleep.
customer_reviews.author: Davina

customer_reviews.title: Not working well with my Cartier Santos
customer_reviews.text: This watch winder doesn't seem to work well with my Cartier Santos. My Cartier stops working after a couple days while in the Watch Winder. It does however work ok with my Tag Heuer.
customer_reviews.author: PBRN

customer_reviews.title: Great value, nice looking, gets job done, a little lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It was a little lighter weight than I expected (feels somewhat plasticy) but was easy to set up and seems to be working great for a little over a week. It looks great for a display piece and gets the job done. All-in-all I think it was a great value. I also have a $300 dual winder and they seem to be operating in sync.
customer_reviews.author: David Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and quiet. Exactly what I was ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and quiet. Exactly what I was looking for. Only improvement would be an on/off switch on the front (or when you open the door).
customer_reviews.author: idkhood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the price
customer_reviews.text: With it's black plastic housing, it's not a beautiful showcase for your watch like the expensive wooden and leather winders available; however, it does it's job well. The winder runs almost silently, holds watches securely, and is easy to use. Multiple winding options, but unfortunately, each winder cannot be set or operated independently.
customer_reviews.author: BBISH

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch winder
customer_reviews.text: I think this winder can be regarded as the economic option for this kind of apparatus, it is made of plastic without fancy materials or chrome finishes. It seems well made nevertheless, solid and nice looking. It works very well with several winding modes, it is very quiet also. If you have so many automatic watches that you need a winder, this is a good option at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto R.C.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to replace an expandable one that I paid more for, and had nothing but trouble with. This is capable of winding 2 watches simultaneously for less than I paid for the replaced winder which only "winds" one watch very badly. This one worked perfectly right out of the box, your basic plug & play, which is all you can ask. I would recommend, for a well priced double winder you won't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why you have to spend a fortune for ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why you have to spend a fortune for a watch winder when this one works perfectly for a fraction of most .
customer_reviews.author: Michael F. Procaccini

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly durable and quiet. Must Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have this for more than 2 years working around the clock, pun intended, and I didn't have one single problem. The winder sits very close to my bed and even in the quietest night I can't tell when it's spinning.
customer_reviews.author: Henrique

customer_reviews.title: Ultra-quiet
customer_reviews.text: Extremely quiet! It's almost impossible to hear the motor noise, I had to place my ear right on the case to even hear it running. Very worth it for it's completely silent operation.
customer_reviews.author: Hanabusa

customer_reviews.title: Wound me up but not my watches.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted (for the second time) less than a year. A waste of money and time. DON’T BUY THIS POS product. Am very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My watches look great in this. Keeps them wound and on time. Quiet but not super quiet. Real value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar O Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Fair unit and fair price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for another older "Diplomat" winder it lasted 2 years or so and worked like it was suppose to. I really think you can't go wrong at that price and service.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot H.

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and looks great
customer_reviews.text: Looks great on my desktop and displays two watches very nicely. It's mesmerizing to watch as it turns. The motor is super quiet and turns on and off without notice based on the various automatic schedules you can choose from on the device. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t seem to function as effortlessly as others I’ve purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Still uncertain if the quality is what I’d hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: James P. OFlaherty

customer_reviews.title: This watch winder is great
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't I get this years ago? Makes your life easier if you have multiple watches that you switch out. No need to update the time/date any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Bru in FL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very mice looking and work perfect, I will order again this item and from this seller
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Flawless!
customer_reviews.text: Has been flawless! Absolutely silent, keeps cheap and nice auto alike ready to go. Make sure to learn which way to spin them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be fine, but these things never last long, couple of years at most.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It does the job, it’s a bit noisy
customer_reviews.text: You have to put it in a place that doesn’t bother you at night
customer_reviews.author: Diego Fernández

customer_reviews.title: This is my second unit. I purchased 1 back ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit. I purchased 1 back in 2013. The lower part stopped working. But for the price it is worth it. This 2nd unit is quieter than my 1st. Hopefully, it last me another 4 or 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: ivbinhad

customer_reviews.title: this unit would NOT wind my two Seiko Kenetic watches ...
customer_reviews.text: this unit would NOT wind my two Seiko Kenetic watches. No clear instructions or directions for any type watches. I returned the unit.
customer_reviews.author: gale grill

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with my watches...
customer_reviews.text: Did not wind my watches... went to send it back and window closed... was trying to see if i was doing something wrong, tried all settings and didn't work. Sucks, but my fault for not sending it back sooner... on the bright side it looks great... LOL
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm, allows me to keep 2 of the 3 automatic watches I have always wound and keeping time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Diplomat Watch Winder
customer_reviews.text: This winder holds large watches better than others I have used. Most battery powered units I have used before are not large enough for Panerai or other large watches and they tend to bind while turning. The Diplomat runs smoothly and never slows down as it is a/c powered. The only disadvantage is that it has to kept near an outlet but I am happy not to have to change batteries for once.
customer_reviews.author: jcflyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product I gave it tree star because I wish ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product I gave it tree star because I wish It had more slots for my watches And also I tink it's a bit expensive
customer_reviews.author: Pedro R.

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: One of the inserts makes a clicking sound on every rotation. This started maybe a month or so after I got it. I initially thought it was the watch shifting on the but even unloaded it makes this noise. Annoying as this winder was in my bedroom and it the click is loud enough to keep me awake, so I moved it. Aside from this it works pretty well and my timepieces stay wound, but I can't recommend this product. Were I doing it over, I would spring for a better quality winder in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Brian/Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Broken door
customer_reviews.text: I received the winder with the door broken. I had no time to work on returning it. I did send pics and a letter. But, never received any comments. Receiving a broken item is understandable but, it is not acceptable that no one responded. The item works but, with the broken door you have to be very careful ( nice item if it had been received in full)
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: Great price good quality works well and very quiet. Will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Whisper quiet, even with 2 watches running constantly.
customer_reviews.text: Almost silent, even with 2 watches running 24/7. Amazing quality for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and so far it is working great. It runs nice and quite.
customer_reviews.author: adam abelson

customer_reviews.title: It’s WORK!
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE** I use for my Patek Philippe, it's perfect Work!!! The movement very quiet, after passed 2 months everything still fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ragoorn

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my 2 seiko divers watches. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 seiko divers watches. I have used it within feet of by bed for 3 months. It makes a faint noise when running bu quiet otherwise. It keeps my watches wound and ready for wear. I chose one setting and hasn't touched it. Well worth the $50.
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: The product was cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: The product is nice and stylish. It looks great in any environment. However, it stopped working after only a few months. There is no communication when I contacted the vendor.
customer_reviews.author: shiller

customer_reviews.title: A Real Timer Saver (get it)
customer_reviews.text: 1st week review. So far everything meets expectations. The winder is easy to use, watches fit perfectly. They also look great in the case (Rolex and Movado.) The machine is quiet, and the matte finish is elegant. No more winding and re-setting the chronographs. This is a time saver. Happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky1

customer_reviews.title: Good product and price
customer_reviews.text: Good product, I have had it for several months and no issues. Lots of settings, it dose make some noise from the bracelets moving not a deal breaker for me. Good product at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Nevada1995

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: Came without any paperwork. I suspect it may have been a refurb. It also made clicking noises with every rotation. Made of cheap plastic as well. It's a "you get what you pay for" purchase. Don't buy unless your half deaf and a really sound sleeper!
customer_reviews.author: John S. Munroe

customer_reviews.title: Great watch winder!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy this winder because my only other one cost a whole lot more and I figured this one probably wouldn't do very well. But I wanted a double slot winder so I bought it. This one works great. It does every thing my more expensive winder does and believe it or not, it is nicer looking. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: stan

customer_reviews.title: It's working pretty well. It's quiet
customer_reviews.text: It's working pretty well. It's quiet. Finished well for plastic. Rotates counter and clock-wise. Keeps my watch running with good accuracy
customer_reviews.author: Kissmysneaks

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for a great value, good looking dual watch winder.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Smaller than I expected, in a good way. It’s clean, looks good, and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

product_meta.title: Diplomat 31-497 Matte Black Finish Watch Winder
product_meta.description:
For over 40 years, Diplomat fulfilled the need of quality, affordable watch accessories with an ever-evolving array of products that satisfies the needs of every level of aficionado. It is with that passion that every Diplomat product is manufactured with one goal in mind: Provide quality products at a price anyone can afford.

Our passion doesn’t end there. Our search for what’s new and exciting drives us to offer a wide range of Watch Cases and Watch Winders ideal for your watch, no matter your need. From carbon-fiber to mahogany, one watch displays all the way up to 20, there’s a Diplomat watch winder or box for you.

At Diplomat, we are so confident in our watch winders, that each one carries a one year warranty. Should your watch winder need to be repaired or serviced, we address the problem quickly and effectively. That’s been our promise from day one. We haven’t deviated from that promise since.



This Diplomat Double automatic watch winder with built in MULTI SETTING SMART IC TIMER, rotates clockwise, counter-clockwise or alternate it will work with all kind of automatic watches. Vertical design helps save space and looks great in the bedroom or office. This automatic watch winder will keep your automatic timepieces wound and ready to wear when you need them. Comparable watch winders sell for well over $350 in fine retail jewelry stores, now you can have one of the finest automatic watch winders at a fraction of that cost. World's finest watches manufacturers use automatic movement of their watches like Rolex , Patek Philippe, Breitling, Movado, IWC, Tag Heuer as well as many other known brand name watch manufacturers. Today's most extravagant timepieces come equipped with the world's most advanced automatic, perpetual movement. To avoid setting the time on these watches daily, use an automatic watch winder to keep constant movement on your watch when you're not wearing it. Great for watch enthusiasts that own multiple watches and change watch styles every couple of days. Top selling gift item! FEATURES Rotation Switch keys by operation: clockwise, auto, and counterclockwise Timer Function Auto Rotate 33 seconds, rest 12 minutes Auto Rotate 10 minutes, rest 90 minutes Auto Rotate 30 minutes, rest 3 hours Auto Rotate 1 hour, rest 3 hours Power: AC Adaptor SPECIFICATIONS Silent motor with directional controls keep any automatic movement wound no matter the style or manufacturer 110V AC Adapter Included Double turntable with 2 adjustable watch holders will fit most watch sizes L 6.5" W 6" H 11.5" inches with glass windows 3" in diameter Watch Winder Weight 2 lb. Winder does not work with Seiko Kinetic Watches.




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :5.5 x 7 x 9.5 inches; 2 Pounds
 * Item model number :31-497
 * Department :WATCHES
 * Date First Available :December 11, 2012
 * Manufacturer :Diplomat
 * ASIN :B00A45ER8W
 * 
 * Domestic Shipping:Item can be shipped within U.S.
 * International Shipping:This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More

 * .zg_hrsr_item {list-style : none};
 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #245,611 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #59 inWatch Winders 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.2 out of 5 stars604 ratings

Clockwise, auto swap or counter-clockwise rotations
